autoop.functional package

Submodules

autoop.functional.feature module

autoop.functional.pipeline_graphing module

autoop.functional.pipeline_graphing.create_pipeline_model(input_features: List[str], hidden_units: int = 4) → str[source]

Creates a Keras model to visualize the data flow through the pipeline.

Args:

input_features (list): A list of input feature names. hidden_units (int): Number of units in the hidden layer (default: 4).

Returns:

BytesIO: A buffer containing the plot of the model as an image.

autoop.functional.pipeline_graphing.generate_training_prediction_plot(training_values: ndarray, predictions: ndarray) → str[source]

Generate a plot comparing training values and predicted values.

Args:

training_values (array-like): The true training values. predictions (array-like): The predicted values from the model. input_data (pd.DataFrame): The input data used for predictions.

Returns:

plt.Figure: The generated plot figure. bytes: The CSV content for download.

autoop.functional.pipeline_graphing.visualise_pipeline(input_features: List[str], X_train: ndarray, y_train: ndarray, epochs: int = 50, batch_size: int = 32) → Tuple[Model, Dict[str, List[float]]][source]

This module provides functions to visualize and create Keras-based pipelines and training plots.

Functions: - visualise_pipeline: Trains a Keras model and plots training loss over

time.

  • create_pipeline_model: Creates and visualizes a Keras model to show data flow through the pipeline.

  • generate_training_prediction_plot: Generates a plot comparing training

values and predictions, saving the plot to a file.
